resources.string: An answer to both questions must be selected to continue
An iCO device is not properly connected, please reconnect the device or choose the manual option
An iCO device is not properly connected or the volume is not high enough on your android phone.
Blow slowly into the monitor, aiming to empty your lungs completely.
Consult your Clinician for more advice.
Sorry, there was an error with the application.
for the Smokerlyzer test is as follows
Complete questions 1 and 2 below, then click continue.
How many cigarrettes do you smoke per day?
How long do you wait until your first cigarette of the day?
Your lungs still contains toxic gases.
Make another effort to stop smoking.

This level of CO indicates you have an established smoking habit and an elevated level of CO your blood as a result, which prevents your body from getting the vital oxygen it needs to function as part of a healthy lifestyle.

If you have reduced this recently, that’s great but there’s a way to go yet. Research has shown that even those who smoke 1-10 cigarettes per day have higher mortality rates than non-smokers and there is no ‘risk-free’ level of exposure to tobacco smoke.
Stopping smoking completely as part of a healthy lifestyle can reduce the risk of smoking related diseases, increase your life expectancy and save you money.
Your CO reading indicates a heavy smoking habit associated with high cigarette usage, the health benefits of stopping smoking for you are huge.

CO from smoking contributes to a lack of oxygen, making your heart work even harder, increasing the risk heart disease, heart attacks, lower immune system, slow healing, erectile dysfunction, anything sound familiar?
Making the decision to stop smoking is the biggest obstacle, so welcome to your first giant step towards a healthier lifestyle and reduced risk of smoking related diseases…of which there are many!
Try cutting down your smoking intake and test your levels regularly to track progress; you can do it!
Almost there! This level of CO indicates you have reduced your smoking intake or have a light/occasional habit but there’s still work to be done.
Research has shown that even those who smoke 1 cigarette per day have higher mortality rates than non-smokers and there is no ‘risk-free’ level of exposure to tobacco smoke.
Stopping smoking completely as part of a healthy lifestyle can reduce the risk of smoking related diseases, increase your life expectancy and save you money.
You have a medium to heavy dependence on nicotine. This means that you may benefit from using stronger NRT products.
You probably have a medium level of dependence. You may benefit from using medium or full strength NRT products.
Congratulations! this is a level consistent with a non-smoker and where you want to be

This marks the start of your happier, healthier, smoke free future. You have greatly reduced your risk of heart failure and smoking related diseases. Food will taste better as your taste buds recover and as the CO reduces in your bloodstream, oxygen will increase.
This is not the end, staying smoke free is often just as hard, so pop in from time to time and give yourself a boost by making sure your CO level is still in the Green zone.
Helping people to stop smoking, one breath at a time.
